Interface ScheduleProducer

  • All Superinterfaces:

    All Known Implementing Classes:

    public interface ScheduleProducer
extends Visualizable

      • Methods inherited from interface org.drools.planner.examples.ras2012.interfaces.Visualizable

        visualize

    • Method Detail

      • getAllWaitTimes

        Map<Node,WaitTime> getAllWaitTimes()
        Retrieve all the existing wait times.

      • getCurrentlyOccupiedArcs

        Collection<Arc> getCurrentlyOccupiedArcs(long time)
        Get every arc that the train is occupying at a given length of time. Arc is either occupied or free, there is no concept of partially-occupied.
        Parameters:
        time - Number in milliseconds, specifying the time since the beginning of world.
        Returns:
        Currently occupied arcs, each once.

      • getDelays

        Map<Node,Long> getDelays()
        Retrieve delays (WaitTimes + possible stops for MOWs) at specific nodes.
        Returns:
        Map, where the key is the node and the value is delay in milliseconds caused by that node.

      • getRoute

        Route getRoute()
        Retrieve the route that this itinerary relates to.
        Returns:
        The route, never null.

      • getSchedule

        SortedMap<Long,Node> getSchedule()
        Retrieve the schedule for the given train on the given route. The schedule takes into account all the maintenance windows and halt points.
        Returns:
        Map, where the key is the time (in milliseconds) and the value is the node reached at that time.

      • getScheduleAdherenceStatus

        Map<Long,Long> getScheduleAdherenceStatus()
        Retrieve the difference between the train's schedule and the reality.
        Returns:
        Key is the time of arrival at the SA checkpoint, value is the difference. Positive when there's been a delay, negative when the train is ahead of schedule. Both times are in milliseconds.

      • getScheduleWithArcs

        SortedMap<Long,Arc> getScheduleWithArcs()
        Retrieve the schedule for the given train on the given route. The schedule takes into account all the maintenance windows and halt points.
        Returns:
        Map, where the key is the time (in milliseconds) and the value is the arc reached at that time.

      • getTimeSpentOnUnpreferredTracks

        long getTimeSpentOnUnpreferredTracks(long time)
        Retrieve the time that the train has spent on unpreferred tracks.
        Parameters:
        time - Time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Number of milliseconds spent on unpreferred tracks.

      • getTrain

        Train getTrain()
        Retrieve the train that this itinerary relates to.
        Returns:
        The train, never null.

      • getWaitTime

        WaitTime getWaitTime(Node n)
        Retrieve the wait time for the given node.
        Parameters:
        n - The node that the wait time should be looked at for.
        Returns:
        The wait time.

      • getWantTimeDifference

        Map<Long,Long> getWantTimeDifference()
        Retrieve the difference between the train's want time and the actual time of arrival.
        Returns:
        Only contains one entry. Key is the time of arrival at the destination node in milliseconds, value is the difference in milliseconds. Positive when there's been a delay, negative when the train is ahead of schedule.

      • isNodeOnRoute

        boolean isNodeOnRoute(Node n)
        Whether or not a given node is on the route, ie. in between train origin and destination (incl.).
        Parameters:
        n - Node to ask for.
        Returns:

      • removeAllWaitTimes

        void removeAllWaitTimes()
        Remove all previously set wait times.

      • removeWaitTime

        WaitTime removeWaitTime(Node n)
        Specify that a train shouldn't wait at a given node.
        Parameters:
        n - The node that the wait time should be removed from.
        Returns:
        The previous wait time for the node, or null.

      • setWaitTime

        WaitTime setWaitTime(WaitTime wait,
                   Node node)
        Specify that a train is supposed to wait when it arrives at a given node.
        Parameters:
        wait - How long to wait for.
        node - What node to wait at.
        Returns:
        The wait time that the node had previously, or null.
